path_1.title: Macho Madness - The Randy Savage Ultimate Collection (2009)
path_1.feeling: Two decades of kayfabe cheerleading did nothing for me.

path_1.title: Escape from L.A. (1996)
path_1.feeling: Goofy, plastic apocalypse with zero pulse.

path_1.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968)
path_1.feeling: A hypnotic, transcendent drift into the cosmic unknown.

path_1.title: Isle of Dogs (2018)
path_1.feeling: Meticulous, charming craft that kept me at an emotional arm's length.

path_1.title: Air Bud (1997)
path_1.feeling: Saccharine gimmickry I couldn't endure.

path_1.title: 17 Again (2009)
path_1.feeling: Sitcom soul in feature-length clothing.

path_1.title: Green Mile, The (1999)
path_1.feeling: Affecting in moments, but swollen with tidy sentiment.

path_1.title: Senna (2010)
path_1.feeling: Electric archival storytelling with a genuine tragic pulse.

path_1.title: Help, The (2011)
path_1.feeling: A polished, safe gloss over thorny realities.

path_1.title: Twilight Saga: Eclipse, The (2010)
path_1.feeling: Moody stares and soap suds masquerading as stakes.

path_1.title: Species (1995)
path_1.feeling: Sleazy pulp dressed up as sci-fi.

path_1.title: Seven (a.k.a. Se7en) (1995)
path_1.feeling: Misery as spectacle isn't my thing.

path_1.title: Meet Joe Black (1998)
path_1.feeling: Languid, oddly mesmerizing fable with pockets of warmth.

path_1.title: Limitless (2011)
path_1.feeling: Slick high-concept emptiness.

path_1.title: Panic Room (2002)
path_1.feeling: Taut packaging, hollow core.

path_1.title: The Hateful Eight (2015)
path_1.feeling: Handsome, venomous chamber piece that overstays its welcome.

path_1.title: Real Steel (2011)
path_1.feeling: Clanking sentimentality with prefab arcs.

path_1.title: The Hateful Eight (2015)
path_1.feeling: Same verdict: stylish nastiness, thin aftertaste.

path_1.title: Showgirls (1995)
path_1.feeling: Garish, mean-spirited sludge.

path_1.title: Wings of Desire (Himmel über Berlin, Der) (1987)
path_1.feeling: Luminous, humane melancholy that lingers.

path_1.title: Just Go with It (2011)
path_1.feeling: Plastic rom-com machinery grinding away.

path_1.title: Clean Slate (1994)
path_1.feeling: One-note premise, no spark.

path_1.title: Down by Law (1986)
path_1.feeling: A deadpan drift I happily sank into.

path_1.title: Blade Runner 2049 (2017)
path_1.feeling: A ravishing, mournful future fugue.

path_1.title: As Good as It Gets (1997)
path_1.feeling: Performances glow

path_1.title: Fools Rush In (1997)
path_1.feeling: Thin culture-clash fluff I couldn't buy.

path_1.title: Groundhog Day (1993)
path_1.feeling: Humane, witty, and quietly profound.

path_1.title: Babel (2006)
path_1.feeling: Big, somber design with scattered resonance.

path_1.title: American History X (1998)
path_1.feeling: Brutal, earnest, imperfect but potent.

path_1.title: Final Destination 3 (2006)
path_1.feeling: Mechanical carnage with no soul.
